info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 11:42AM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Berkshire County through 1230 PM EDT... At 1142 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Lenox, or near Pittsfield, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Pittsfield, Lee, Lenox, Becket, Dalton, Hinsdale, Richmond, West Stockbridge, Peru, Washington, Barkerville, Mahkeenac Heights, Tanglewood, New Lenox, Lenox Dale, The Center At Lenox, Adams Junction, Yankee Orchards, Stearnsville and Carey Corner. People attending Tanglewood should seek safe shelter immediately! MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
